Vaccination (Pedia and Adult)

Vaccination is a vital part of preventive healthcare that protects both children and adults from serious and potentially life-threatening diseases. It helps strengthen the body’s immune system and prevents the spread of infections.

Why Vaccination is Important

  • Prevents the spread of infectious diseases
  • Protects vulnerable groups such as infants and the elderly
  • Reduces healthcare costs by preventing illness
  • Contributes to community immunity (herd protection)
Did You Know? Vaccines have saved millions of lives and are one of the safest and most effective public health interventions ever developed.

Common Pediatric Vaccines

- BCG (Tuberculosis)
- DPT (Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus)
- Polio
- MMR (Measles, Mumps, Rubella)
- Hepatitis B
- Pneumococcal and Rotavirus vaccines

Adult Vaccinations

Adults may also require immunizations to stay protected against diseases such as influenza, tetanus, hepatitis, and HPV. Booster shots and annual flu vaccines are highly recommended.
